meanings.definition: The fact of two or more events or circumstances happening or existing at the same time.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, the concurrencies of discussions made it hard to follow.
meanings.sent2: The concurrencies of the traffic lights caused a delay in our journey.
meanings.sent3: The concurrencies of everyone wearing the same color shirt was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The concurrencies of emotions and thoughts created a storm within her.
meanings.sent5: The concurrencies of the clocks ticking loudly made the room chaotic.

meanings.definition: The state of two or more things occurring or existing at the same time.
meanings.sent1: The concurrencies of the thunder and lightning signaled an approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: In the busy city, the concurrencies of sirens and honking filled the air.
meanings.sent3: The concurrencies of birthdays in the office led to a cake overload.
meanings.sent4: The concurrencies of dreams and reality blurred in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The concurrencies of the birds chirping and leaves rustling created a peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The simultaneous occurrence of events or circumstances.
meanings.sent1: The concurrencies of the power outage and heavy rain made the situation worse.
meanings.sent2: During the festival, the concurrencies of performances delighted the audience.
meanings.sent3: The concurrencies of the dogs barking and cats meowing sounded like a concert.
meanings.sent4: The concurrencies of laughter and tears echoed through the room.
meanings.sent5: The concurrencies of the waves crashing and seagulls calling created a serene beach scene.
